patterns: Which language is more prefered C++ or java or python?
which programming language to start with
is C++/java/python the best to start as a beginner
responses: You can start with either python or cpp. Python is taught in first semester from basics but simultaneously keep doing c++ also yourself. cpp is best for competitive coding and also required for some computer science core courses in 3rd sem. Its basic will not be taught by college.

patterns: how to dual boot ubuntu or linux
how to use windows and linux
responses:
Linux is the preferred OS among programmers due to its speed, security, and availability of a wide range of customizations. It is open-source and there are tons of resources for almost anything you want to do.
There are 3 ways to get it on your windows machine each having its set of advantages and disadvantages
1. Dual boot:- http://blog.pc.iitmandi.co.in/Dual-Boot/
2. WSL 2:- https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install-win10#manual-installation-steps
3. Virtual box:- https://itsfoss.com/install-linux-in-virtualbox/
Some other resources
Link1 - https://towardsdatascience.com/dual-boot-is-dead-windows-and-linux-are-now-one-27555902a128
Link2 - https://www.reddit.com/r/bashonubuntuonwindows/comments/gqkmet/wsl_1_vs_wsl_2_vs_vm_vs_dual_boot/

For python install anaconda as it provides all libraries and packages which will be useful in data science
https://www.datacamp.com/community/tutorials/installing-anaconda-windows

some video tutorials to learn basics quickly. 
A suggestion: https://youtu.be/rfscVS0vtbw

patterns: how can i participate in gsoc
responses: Google Summer Of Code or GSoC is an annual program run by Google where you get to work on many open source projects during your summer vacations and also earn a stipend.

responses: Programming Club, aka KamandPrompt is a group of clubs where students can acquire knowledge and gain experience in the field of Competitive Programming, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Development. for more info https://wiki.iitmandi.co.in/p/Programming_Club

patterns: Are there high tech labs available for programming?
is IIT mandi equipped with proper programming labs
responses: Yes, we have high tech well equipped labs for programming.You will enjoy high internet speed in those labs as well.

patterns: how is coding culture of IIT Mandi
How many Gsoc selection do we have
how is open source at IIT Mandi
responses:
GSoC selections for 2020:
Indore : 3 students
Ropar : 2 students
Patna : 6 students
Hyderabad : 1 student
Bhubaneshwar : 1 student
Gandhinagar : Noone from their college knows (I think 0)
Mandi : 9 students + 6 mentors

We have good amount of experts, candidate masters and even a master now on codeforces and many 4*+ rated at codechef.

Open source culture is better at our college. as shown by GSoC selections. Apart from the GSoC selections, many were also selected in Linux community bridge, which is an equally prestigious program.

Data sources for IIT Mandi.  
https://pc.iitmandi.co.in/icpc/hof.html
https://pc.iitmandi.co.in/gsoc/

Please refer this video about basic installation and compiling code in VS code
https://youtu.be/0yn7irrHzM8

patterns: how to use Visual studio Code
responses:
You can use VS code for any language:
FOR C++: https://youtu.be/0yn7irrHzM8
FOR Java: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/java/java-tutorial

Everyone should have a basic idea of programming from today's session so it's time to show your strength and start practicing on URI online Judge  (www.urionlinejudge.com.br), start with beginner-level questions, and then level up
To solve compilation error run the code in terminal or VS code and search for error and try to fix it

patterns: why i am getting runtime error
responses: Some error which could not be detected during compilation like division be zero for some case or array out of bound

patterns: why i am getting presentation error
responses: Presentation error is due to extra spaces/no spaces, extra new lines/no new lines

patterns: how to start with competitive coding
responses: Programming is fun, programming is an exercise for your brain, programming is a mental sport and when this sport is held over the internet involving sport programmer as a contestant then it is called Competitive Programming. follow this link and you will soon with your hardwork become a competitive coder https://docs.google.com/document/d/1czqj3F116XgtcZx4sDjIA7cKYy5mu7zMCXGhL0UKweU/edit

Android/Mobile Application Dev - You can follow courses on udacity which are quite good to learn. Try to make your own app. You can choose to begin with any fluuter/kotlin/Java. Web dev http://blog.pc.iitmandi.co.in/web-development-for-freshers/

patterns: how to begin with cyber security
how to get involved with infosec
responses: CTF are a good way to start with cyber security. We don't have any specific cyber security club. Follow this link https://medium.com/@_ax/how-to-start-a-career-in-cybersecurity-and-how-to-become-an-expert-5f8f8e7ce42a
